intro: Psychotria scrobiculata, commonly known as the "Garden Nightshade," is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the evening. Psychotria scrobiculata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and gardens. It is also known for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its uses.
